content: over cc repeat decrease row 1-6 switching to dpn when necessary until 24 sts remain with the mc yarn only k2tog all the way around resulting in 12 sts finishing cut mc and cc yarn leaving about a 12 tail of each thread mc tail onto yarn needle and slip through the remaining 12 stitches on needles one or two times slip off needles and pull snug slip tail through center hole and use to attach pompom or button weave in any other loose threads block using your preferred method i typically soak my hats for 15 minutes in warm water and spin it on gentle in my washing machine i then stretch the hat over a suitably sized mixing bowl being sure that the ribbing curls underneath the bowl and is not stretched i let the hat get about 80% dry and then take it off the bowl and lie it flat on a towel to dry fully all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit if you want to add a pompon you may make your own or purchase one or use a decorative button attach at top center hole using method of your choice this should be your last step and done after blocking abbreviations dpn - set of 4 double pointed needles mc main color yarn cc contrasting color yarn st or sts stitch es k- knit p purl bor beginning of row marker sm slip marker kf/b in a single st knit 1 stitch in front and then a second in back of stitch increasing 1 st to 2 st k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip 1 st then slip the next st insert left needle into the front loops of the slipped sts and knit them together note checkerboard mittens pictured on the left are from a pattern in robin hansen s favorite mittens book all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2024kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit
